argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | syldan.1 | |- ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> ch ) |
| 2 |  | syldan.2 | |- ( ( ph /\ ch ) -> th ) |
| 3 | 1, 2 | #P_syldan | |- ( ( ph /\ ps ) -> th ) |
\
 Stoic logic Thema 2 version a. Statement T2 of [Bobzien] p. 117 shows a reconstructed version of Stoic logic thema 2 as follows:  "When from two assertibles a third follows, and from the third and one (or both) of the two another follows, then this other follows from the first two." Bobzien uses constructs such as ` ph ` , ` ps |- ch ` ; in Metamath we will represent that construct as ` ph /\ ps -> ch ` . This version a is without the phrase "or both"; see ~ stoic2b for the version with the phrase "or both".  We already have this rule as ~ syldan , so here we show the equivalence and discourage its use. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 17-Feb-2019.)
